DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points to define the boundary of the area. Add as many points as necessary to accurately reflect the area's size and shape.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points. The information fields should be moveable and scalable as a block within the area.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points to define the boundary of the area. Add as many points as necessary to accurately reflect the area’s size and shape. The LAA point symbol requires one anchor point and is connected to the area symbol with a straight line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points. The information fields should be moveable and scalable as a block within the area.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points to define the boundary of the area. Add as many points as necessary to accurately reflect the area's size and shape.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points.
DrawRule.Orientation: The side opposite Field B (Echelon) faces toward the hostile force.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points to define the boundary of the area. Add as many points as necessary to accurately reflect the area's size and shape.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points. The information fields should be moveable and scalable as a block within the area. The default tic length should be the same as the text height of the echelon field (B). Spacing between the tics should also be the height of B. Users should be provided a facility to allow them to manually alter the height of B, which in turn should affect the tic length and spacing accordingly.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the semicircle's opening. Point 3 defines the end of the arrow.
DrawRule.SizeShape: . Points 1 and 2 determine the diameter of the semicircle and point 3 determines the length of the arrow. The tip of the arrowhead will be at the center point of the semicircle's diameter and will project perpendicularly from the line between points 1 and 2. The default tic length should be the same as the text height of the echelon field (B). Spacing between the tics should also be the height of B. Users should be provided a facility to allow them to manually alter the height of B, which in turn should affect the tic length and spacing accordingly.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening typically faces enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires two anchor points. Point 1 defines the center point of the graphic and point 2 defines the graphic’s start point and radius.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 will determine a radius that is long enough for the graphic to encompass the feature(s) being retained. The opening will be a 30-degree arc of the circle. The default tic length should be the same as the text height of the echelon field (R). Spacing between the tics should also be the height of R. Users should be provided a facility to allow them to manually alter the height of R, which in turn should affect the tic length and spacing accordingly.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening will be on the friendly side of the graphic.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Point 1 is the tip of the arrowhead. Points 2 and 3 define the endpoints of the straight line on the back side of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 2 and 3 determine the length of the straight line on the back side of the symbol. The rear of the arrow should connect to the midpoint of the line between points 2 and 3.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The back side of the symbol encompasses the firing position, while the arrowhead typically points at the target.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires four anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the straight line on the back side of the symbol. Points 3 and 4 define the tips of the arrowheads.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the straight line on the back side of the symbol. The rear of the arrows should connect to points 1 and 2.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The back side of the symbol encompasses the firing position, while the arrowheads typically indicate the left and right limits of coverage that the firing position is meant to support.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least three anchor points to define the boundary of the area. Add as many points as necessary to accurately reflect the area’s size and shape.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points.
DrawRule.Orientation: Not applicable. The area will encompass two or more fire support graphics (point/single target, nuclear target, circular target, rectangular target, or area target). The naming convention determines whether the area describes a series or group of targets.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires a minimum of three (3) and a maximum of six (6) anchor points to define the boundary of the area. The anchor points shall be sequentially numbered, in increments of one (1), beginning with point one (1).
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points. The information fields should be moveable and scalable as a block within the area.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the graphic’s vertical line. Point 3 defines the endpoint of the graphic’s horizontal line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the vertical line. The length of the horizontal line is determined by plotting point 3 on a plane extending perpendicularly from the midpoint of the vertical line.
DrawRule.Orientation: The head of the “T” typically faces enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the end points of the symbol’s vertical line. Point 3 defines the tip of the longest arrow.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the height of the symbol and point 3 determines its length. The spacing between the symbol’s arrows will stay proportional to the symbol’s vertical line. The length of the short arrows will remain in proportion to the length of the longest arrow.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrows point away from enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the corners of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the straight line. The radius of the semicircle is ½ the length of the straight line.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires four anchor points. The center point defines the center of the symbol. Points 1, 2 and 3 define the radii of circles 1, 2 and 3.
DrawRule.SizeShape: As defined by the operator.
DrawRule.Orientation: The center point is typically centered over the known/suspected source location of a CBRN event.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires two anchor points. Point 1 defines the center point of the graphic and point 2 defines the graphic’s start point and radius.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The radius will be long enough for the graphic to encompass the UEI(s) or feature(s) being isolated. The opening will be a 30 degree arc of the circle.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening will be on the friendly side of the graphic.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires two anchor points. Point 1 defines the center point of the graphic and point 2 defines the graphic’s start point and radius.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 will determine a radius that is long enough for the graphic to encompass the feature(s) being occupied. The opening will be a 30-degree arc of the circle.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening will be on the friendly side of the control measure.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the graphic’s vertical line. Point 3 defines the rear of the graphic.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the height of the graphic and point 3 determines its length. The arrow will project perpendicularly from the midpoint of the vertical line.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrow points toward enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires four anchor points. Point 1 defines the tip of the first arrowhead. Point 2 defines the end of the straight line portion of the first arrow. Point 3 defines the tip of the second arrowhead. Point 4 defines the end of the second arrow.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 and points 3 and 4 determine the length of each arrow. Points 2 and 3 shall be connected by a smooth, curved line.
DrawRule.Orientation: Determined by the anchor points. The unit being relieved is typically located at the base of the curve and the unit performing the relief is typically located at the end of the symbol. The arrowhead typically points to the location the relieved unit should move to.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires two anchor points. Point 1 defines the center point of the graphic and point 2 defines the graphic’s start point and radius.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 will determine a radius that is long enough for the graphic to encompass the feature(s) being secured. The opening will be a 30-degree arc of the circle.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening will be on the friendly side of the graphic.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The anchor point defines/is the tip of the inverted cone.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The center point defines/is the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is typically centered over the desired location.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Point 1 is the tip of the arrowhead. Points 2 and 3 define the endpoints of the curved line on the back side of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 2 and 3 determine the length of the curved line on the back side of the symbol. The rear of the arrow should connect to the midpoint of the line between points 2 and 3.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The back side of the symbol encompasses the ambush position with the airhead shaft positioned at the center of mass, while the arrowhead points in the direction of fire.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The center point defines the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Static. Maneuver area graphic shall be drawn with a black border. Maneuver areas may be either unfilled or filled with performance-contoured color options.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is typically centered over the desired location.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The point defines the bottom of the central vertical line in the symbol where the curved and vertical lines meet.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright (as shown in the template and example).

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The point defines the point where all the lines meet.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright (as shown in the example).

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The anchor point defines/is the center of the bottom of the control measure symbol as shown in the template and example.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The anchor point defines the midpoint of the symbol’s base.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright (as shown in the template and example).

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The center point defines the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Static. The symbol’s corners form a 70- degree angle.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is typically centered over the desired location. A user can use this symbol to define a new type of point if the selection that follows is not sufficient.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor (center) point. The point defines the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Static. The symbol's height should be 2x the symbol's width.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol’s center point is typically centered over the desired location. The symbol shall be oriented upright, as shown in the examples.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The point defines the center of the circle.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Static. The diameter of the circle should be 1/2 the height of the symbol.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol’s center point is typically centered over the desired location. The symbol will be oriented upright, as shown in the example.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one center point. The point defines the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Static. Length is 2x the size of height.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is centered over the desired location. The symbol shall be oriented upright, as shown in the example.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the tips of the arrowheads and point 3 defines the rear of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the symbol’s height and point 3 determines its length. The vertical line at the rear of the symbol will be the same length as the opening.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening typically faces enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The center point defines the center of the circle.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is typically centered over the desired location.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires one anchor point. The center point defines the center of the graphic.
DrawRule.SizeShape: There should be 45 degrees of angular separation between the two arrows.
DrawRule.Orientation: The graphic is typically centered over the desired location.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points, points 1 and 2, to define the line. Additional points can be defined to extend the line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The first and last anchor points determine the length of the line.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the order in which the anchor points are entered.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points, points 1 and 2, to define the line. Additional points can be defined to extend the line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The first and last anchor points determine the length of the line. The end-of line information will typically be posted at the ends of the line as it is displayed on the screen.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the order in which the anchor points are entered.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Point 1 defines the vertex of the symbol. Points 2 and 3 define the tips of the arrowheads.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The length and orientation of the arrows can vary independently.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The arrowheads may touch other symbols that define the limits of the task. The top of the tactical symbol indicator may touch point 1.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires two anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the corner points of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The symbol varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires two anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The symbol varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: One point defines the origin from which the bearing is being taken and the other point defines the location or direction from which a contact is made.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires 3 anchor points. Point 1 defines the vertex of the symbol and points 2 and 3 define its endpoints.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1, 2 and 3 determine the length of the lines connecting them. The line defined by points 1 and 2 is typically the same length as the line between points 2 and 3.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points, points 1 and 2, to define the line. Additional points can be defined to extend the line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The first and last anchor points determine the length of the line. The line information will be posted once at the center of the line as it is displayed on the screen.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the order in which the anchor points are entered.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires a minimum of two (2) anchor points. Up to 298 additional points can be added to extend the line. The first point (point 1) defines the start point. The last point defines the endpoint. The points are numbered sequentially beginning with point one (1), in increments of one.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The anchor points define the size and shape.
DrawRule.Orientation: The orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires 2 anchor points. Point 1 defines the tip of the arrowhead and point 2 defines the rear of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol, which varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: The orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires two anchor points. Point 1 defines the rear of the symbol. Point 2 defines the tip of the arrowhead. Point 3 defines the 90 degree arc.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 are connected by a 90 degree arc. Point 3 indicates on which side of the line the arc is placed.
DrawRule.Orientation: The rear of the symbol identifies the enemy’s location and the arrow points in the direction the obstacle should force the enemy to turn.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires four points. Points 1 and 2 define one side of the gap and points 3 and 4 define the opposite side of the gap.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the symbol and point 3 defines the location of one side of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the centerline of the symbol and point 3 determines its width.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points, points 1 and 2, to define the line. Additional points can be defined to extend the line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The first and last anchor points determine the length of the line. The size of the tooth does not change.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires two anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the tips of the arrowheads.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol, which varies only in length. The lines of the arrowhead will form an acute angle.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the vertical straight line portion of the symbol. Point 3 defines an end of the horizontal line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the vertical, straight-line portion of the symbol and point 3 determines its width. The distance between the line connecting points 1 and 2 and point 3 is the radius of the 90 degree arc at the bottom of the symbol.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires four points. Points 1 and 2 define one side of the assault crossing site and points 3 and 4 define the opposite side of the assault crossing site.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the first line. Point 3 defines the location of the parallel line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol. Point 3 determines its width.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires two anchor points. Points 1 and two define the tips of the arrowheads
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol, which varies only in length. The arrowheads will be filled-in versions of a common arrowhead.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires two anchor points. Points 1 and two define the corners on the front of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol, which varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires 2 anchor points. Point 1 is the midpoint of the base opposite the tip of the arrowhead and point 2 defines the rear of the symbol.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the symbol, which varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: The orientation is determined by the anchor points.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires at least two anchor points to define the line. Additional points can be defined to extend and shape the line.
DrawRule.SizeShape: The first and last anchor points determine the length of the line.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the order in which the anchor points are entered.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the graphic’s opening and point 3 defines the rear of the graphic.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the graphic’s height and point 3 determines its length. The vertical line at the rear of the graphic will be the same height as the opening and parallel to it.
DrawRule.Orientation: The opening defines the span of the breach and typically faces enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires three anchor points. Points 1 and 2 define the endpoints of the graphic’s vertical line and point 3 defines the rear of the graphic.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the graphic’s height and point 3 determines its length. The spacing between the graphic’s arrows will stay proportional to the graphic’s height. The tip of the middle arrowhead will be at the midpoint of the vertical line. The arrows will stay perpendicular to the vertical line, regardless of the rotational orientation of the graphic as a whole.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrows typically point toward enemy forces.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires three anchor points. Point 1 defines the tip of the arrowhead. Point 2 defines the end of the straight line portion of the graphic. Point 3 defines the diameter and orientation of the 180 degree circular arc.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the straight line portion of the symbol. Point 3 defines which side of the line the arc is on and the diameter of the arc.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrow points in the direction of the action. The tip of the arrowhead may indicate the location where the action is to conclude. The unit’s current location is typically represented at the base of the arc. The 180 degree circular arc is always perpendicular to the line.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This graphic requires exactly two anchor points. Point 1 defines the tip of the arrowhead and point 2 defines the rear of the graphic.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 1 and 2 determine the length of the graphic, which varies only in length.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrow typically points in the direction of the action.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: Where four points are available Point 1 and Point 2 define the ends of one arrow and Point 3 and Point 4 define the ends of the other arrow. Point 1 and Point 4 define the ends of their respective arrowheads. Where three points are available Point 1 defines the vertex of the graphic. Points 2 and 3 define the tips of the arrowheads.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Where four points are available, Points 1 and 2 and Points 3 and 4 determine the length of the arrows. Where three points are available Points 1 and 2 and points 1 and 3 determine the length of the arrows. The length and orientation of the arrows can vary independently.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The arrowheads may touch other graphics that define the limits of the task. The tactical symbol indicator is centered between point 2 and point 3 when four points are in use or centered on Point 1 when three points are in use.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: Where four points are available Point 1 defines the center of the circle. Point 2 defines the radius of the circle. Point 3 defines the curvature of the arc. Point 4 defines the end of the arrow. Where three points are available Point 1 defines the center point of the circle. Point 2 defines the tip of the arrowhead. Point 3 defines the 90 degree arc.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Where four points are available, Points 1 and 2 define the size of the circle, which should be adjusted as needed to contain the unit assigned the task. Point 3 controls the curvature of the arc. Point 4 defines the end of the arrow. Where three points are available Points 1 and 2 are connected by a 90 degree arc. The circle will at least be large enough to accommodate a tactical symbol. Point 3 indicates on which side of the line the arc is placed.
DrawRule.Orientation: The arrowhead identifies the location/object to be seized and the circle identifies the unit(s) assigned the task. See paragraph 5.3.11 for options to accommodate multiple units.

Amplifier.Label: Special C2 Headquarters
Amplifier.Description: A text modifier for units; indicator is contained inside the frame; contains the name of the special C2 Headquarters.

Amplifier.Label: Feint/Dummy Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies an offensive or defensive unit intended to draw the enemy's attention away from the area of the main attack.

Amplifier.Label: Installation
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used to show a particular symbol denotes an installation.

Amplifier.Label: Platform Type
Amplifier.Description: Electronic Intelligence Notation (ELNOT) or Communications Intelligence Notation (CENOT)

Amplifier.Label: Equipment Teardown Time
Amplifier.Description: Equipment teardown time in minutes

Amplifier.Label: Common Identifier
Amplifier.Description: Example: 'Hawk' for Hawk SAM system

Amplifier.Label: Auxiliary Equipment Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier for equipment that indicates the presence of a towed sonar array.

Amplifier.Label: Area of Uncertainty
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier for units, equipment and installations that indicates the area where an object is most likely to be, based on the object's last report and the reporting accuracty of the sensor that detected the object.

Amplifier.Label: Dead Reckoning Trailer
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies where an object should be located at present, given its last reported course and speed.

Amplifier.Label: Speed Leader
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that depicts the speed and direction of movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Pairing Line
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that connects two objects and is updated dynamically as the positions of the objects change.

Amplifier.Label: Operational Condition
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for equipment or installations that indicates operational condition or capacity.

Amplifier.Label: Engagement Bar
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for equipment or installations that indicates operational condition or capacity.

Amplifier.Label: Target Designator
Amplifier.Description: A six character text modifier used in Fire Support operations to uniquely designate targets in accordance with STANAG 2147, where characters 1 and 2 are alphabetic, and characters 3-6 are numeric: AANNNN

Amplifier.Label: Guarded Unit
Amplifier.Description: During ballistic missile defense, some tracks are designated as guarded by a particular unit.

Amplifier.Label: Special Designator
Amplifier.Description: Special track designators such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks are denoted here.

Amplifier.Label: Country
Amplifier.Description: Identifies the country of the organization being shown.

Amplifier.Label: Symbol Icon
Amplifier.Description: The innermost part of a symbol that represents a joint military object.

Amplifier.Label: Echelon
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier in a unit symbol that identifies command level.

Amplifier.Label: Quantity
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present.

Amplifier.Label: Task Force Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier that identifies a unit or stability operations symbol as a task force.

Amplifier.Label: Frame Shape Modifier
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier that displays affiliation, battle dimension, or exercise amplifying descriptors of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Reinforced or Reduced
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier in a unit symbol that dispays (+) for reinforced, (-) for reduced, (±) for reinforced and reduced.

Amplifier.Label: Staff Comments
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Amplifier.Label: Additional Information
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Amplifier.Label: Evaluation Rating
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.

Amplifier.Label: Combat Effectiveness
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.

Amplifier.Label: Signature Equipment
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for hostile equipment, '!' indicates detectable electronic signatures.

Amplifier.Label: Higher Formation
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units that indicates number or title of higher echelon command (corps are designated by Roman numerals).

Amplifier.Label: Hostile (Enemy)
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for equipment, letters 'ENY' denote hostile symbols.

Amplifier.Label: IFF/SIF/AIS
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes.

Amplifier.Label: Direction of Movement Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Mobility Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: SIGINT Mobility Indicator
Amplifier.Description: M=Mobile, S=Static, or U=Uncertain

Amplifier.Label: Headquarters Staff Indicator/Offset Location Indicator
Amplifier.Description: Headquarters staff indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies a unit as a headquarters.
Amplifier.Remarks: Offset location indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used when placing an object away from its actual location.

Amplifier.Label: Unique Designation
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Amplifier.Remarks: Identifies acquisition number when used with SIGINT symbology.

Amplifier.Label: Type
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Amplifier.Label: Date/Time Group (DTG)
Amplifier.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a date-time group (DDHHMMSSZMONYYYY) or O/O for on order.
Amplifier.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by four digits representing the year.

Amplifier.Label: Altitude/Depth
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that displays either altitude, flight level, depth for submerged objects.
Amplifier.Remarks: Alternatively, used to indicate the height of equipment or structures on the ground.

Amplifier.Label: Location
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that displays a symbol's location in degrees, minutes, and decimal minutes.
Amplifier.Remarks: Alternatively, in MGRS or other applicable display format.
Amplifier.Note: To support homeland security and homeland defense, the federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) US National Grid (USNG) standard when referenced to North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) is operationally equivalent to and is an accepted substitute for MGRS coordinates referenced to WGS 84. Note that at mapping scales of 1:5000 and smaller, NAD83 and WGS 84 are considered equivalent.

Amplifier.Label: Speed
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD 6040.

ContextAmplifier.Description: Graphic Amplifier may be specified by extension

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Aircraft: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Air Vehicle Icon
Field.Description: Uses icon and sector modifiers

Field.Name: P
Field.Label: IFF/SIF
Field.Description: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF Identification modes and codes. Display priority: Mode 5, Mode S, Mode 4, Mode 2, Mode 3
Field.Remarks: Mode 2 Prefix: 2:#### Example: 2:1234

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: X
Field.Label: Altitude
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units that displays altitude flight level.
Field.Remarks: Measurement units shall be displayed within the string. Examples: 1500MSL FL150

Field.Name: Z
Field.Label: Speed
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD-6040.

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Satellite: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Space Vehicle Icon
Field.Description: Uses icon and sector modifiers

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: X
Field.Label: Altitude
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units that displays altitude flight level.
Field.Remarks: Measurement units shall be displayed within the string. Examples: 1500MSL FL150

Field.Name: Z
Field.Label: Speed
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD-6040.

Field.Name: AA
Field.Label: Special C2 Headquarters
Field.Description: A text modifier for units; indicator is contained inside the frame; contains the name of the special C2 Headquarters.

Field.Name: AB
Field.Label: Feint/Dummy Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies an offensive or defensive unit intended to draw the enemy's attention away from the area of the main attack.

Field.Name: AC
Field.Label: Installation
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used to show a particular symbol denotes an installation.

Field.Name: AD
Field.Label: Platform Type
Field.Description: Electronic Intelligence Notation (ELNOT) or Communications Intelligence Notation (CENOT)

Field.Name: AE
Field.Label: Equipment Teardown Time
Field.Description: Equipment teardown time in minutes

Field.Name: AF
Field.Label: Common Identifier
Field.Description: Example: 'Hawk' for Hawk SAM system

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Satellite: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: AR
Field.Label: Special Designator
Field.Description: Special track designators such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks are denoted here.
Field.Remarks: No Location designated in MIL-STD-2525D

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Basic Branch/Function Icon
Field.Description: The innermost part of a symbol that represents a joint military object.

Field.Name: B
Field.Label: Echelon
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier in a unit symbol that identifies command level.

Field.Name: C
Field.Label: Quantity
Field.Description: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present.

Field.Name: D
Field.Label: Task Force Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier that identifies a unit or stability operations symbol as a task force.

Field.Name: F
Field.Label: Reinforced or Reduced
Field.Description: A text amplifier in a unit symbol that dispays (+) for reinforced, (-) for reduced, (±) for reinforced and reduced.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Information
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Field.Name: J
Field.Label: Evaluation Rating
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.
Field.Remarks: Reliability: A-F and Credibility: 1-6

Field.Name: K
Field.Label: Combat Effectiveness
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.
Field.Remarks: Fully Operational = FO, Substantially Operational = SO, Marginally Operational = MO, Not Operational = NO, Unknown = UNK

Field.Name: L
Field.Label: Signature Equipment
Field.Description: A text amplifier for hostile equipment, '!' indicates detectable electronic signatures.

Field.Name: M
Field.Label: Higher Formation
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units that indicates number or title of higher echelon command (corps are designated by Roman numerals).

Field.Name: N
Field.Label: Hostile (Enemy)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment, letters 'ENY' denote hostile symbols.

Field.Name: P
Field.Label: IFF/SIF
Field.Description: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes. Display priority: Mode 5, Mode S, Mode 4, Mode 2, Mode 3
Field.Remarks: M:CCCC, where M = Mode, CCCC = Code

Field.Name: Q
Field.Label: Direction of Movement Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Field.Name: R
Field.Label: Mobility Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Headquarters Staff Indicator/Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: Headquarters staff indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies a unit as a headquarters.
Field.Remarks: Offset location indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used when placing an object away from its actual location.

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group (DTG)
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a date-time group or on order.
Field.Remarks: DDHHMMSSZMONYYYY or O/O, where DD = Day, HH = Hour, MM = Minute, SS = Second, Z = Time Zone, MON = Month, YYYY = Year, O/O = On Order

Field.Name: X
Field.Label: Altitude
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units that displays altitude flight level.
Field.Remarks: Measurement units shall be displayed within the string. Examples: 1500MSL FL150

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that displays a symbol's location in degrees, minutes, and decimal minutes.
Field.Remarks: Alternatively, in MGRS or other applicable display format.

Field.Name: Z
Field.Label: Speed
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD-6040.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group (DTG)
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a date-time group or on order.
Field.Remarks: DDHHMMSSZMONYYYY or O/O, where DD = Day, HH = Hour, MM = Minute, SS = Second, Z = Time Zone, MON = Month, YYYY = Year, O/O = On Order

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Satellite: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: AQ
Field.Label: Guarded Unit
Field.Description: During ballistic missile defense, some tracks are designated as guarded by a particular unit.
Field.Remarks: The 2-character string, BG

Field.Name: AR
Field.Label: Special Designator
Field.Description: Special track designators, such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks, are denoted here.
Field.Remarks: The 3-character strings, NRT or SIG

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Ship Icon
Field.Description: Uses icon and sector modifiers

Field.Name: P
Field.Label: Automatic Identification System (AIS)
Field.Description: A text amplifier displaying the maritime Automatic Identification System.

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Field.Name: Z
Field.Label: Speed
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD-6040.

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Satellite: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: AQ
Field.Label: Guarded Unit
Field.Description: During ballistic missile defense, some tracks are designated as guarded by a particular unit.
Field.Remarks: The 2-character string, BG

Field.Name: AR
Field.Label: Special Designator
Field.Description: Special track designators, such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks, are denoted here.
Field.Remarks: The 3-character strings, NRT or SIG

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: AS
Field.Label: Country Indicator
Field.Description: A three-letter code that indicates the country of origin of the organization (STANAG 1059).
Field.Remarks: In stability activities, this field can be used for factions or groups.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: Free text.
Field.Remarks: Can be used by staff for information required by commander.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Informartion
Field.Description: Free text.

Field.Name: J
Field.Label: Evaluation Rating
Field.Description: Degree of confidence that may be placed on the information represented by the symbol.
Field.Remarks: It is shown as one letter and one number made up of Reliability of Source and Credibility of Information.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: It is used to denote precise location.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a datetime group (DDHHMMSSZMONYY) or O/O for on order.
Field.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by two digits.

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Field.Name: AM
Field.Label: Distance
Field.Description: A numeric amplifier that displays a minimum, maximum, or a specific distance (range, radius, width, length, etc.) in meters.

Field.Name: AN
Field.Label: Azimuth
Field.Description: A numeric amplifier that displays an angle measured from true north to any other line in degrees.

Field.Name: AP
Field.Label: Target Designator
Field.Description: A six character text modifier used in Fire Support operations to uniquely designate targets in accordance with STANAG 2147.
Field.Remarks: AANNNN where A = Alphabetic, N = Numeric

Field.Name: AS
Field.Label: Country Indicator
Field.Description: A three-letter code that indicates the country of origin of the organization (STANAG 1059).
Field.Remarks: In stability activities, this field can be used for factions or groups.

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Symbol Icon
Field.Description: The innermost part of a symbol that represents a joint military object.

Field.Name: B
Field.Label: Echelon
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier in a unit symbol that identifies command level.

Field.Name: C
Field.Label: Quantity
Field.Description: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Information
Field.Description: A text amplifier for control measure symbols; content is implementation specific.

Field.Name: N
Field.Label: Hostile (Enemy)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for control measure symbols; the letters 'ENY' denote hostile control measure symbols.

Field.Name: Q
Field.Label: Direction of Movement Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for events that identifies the direction of movement.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: A graphic amplifier for points and CBRN events used when placing an object away from its actual location.

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation
Field.Description: A text amplifier that uniquely identifies a particular control measure symbol or target number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579 Nuclear: delivery unit

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group (DTG)
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a date-time group or on order.
Field.Remarks: DDHHMMSSZMONYYYY or O/O, where DD = Day, HH = Hour, MM = Minute, SS = Second, Z = Time Zone, MON = Month, YYYY = Year, O/O = On Order

Field.Name: X
Field.Label: Altitude/Depth
Field.Description: A text amplifier that displays the minimum, maximum and/or specific altitude (in feet or meters), flight level, or depth.
Field.Remarks: Measurement units shall be displayed within the string. Examples: 1500MSL FL150

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier that displays a graphic's location in degrees, minutes, and decimal minutes.
Field.Remarks: Alternatively, in MGRS or other applicable display format.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: Free text.
Field.Remarks: Can be used by staff for information required by commander.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Informartion
Field.Description: Free text.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: It is used to denote precise location.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a datetime group (DDHHMMSSZMONYY) or O/O for on order.
Field.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by two digits.

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Amplifier.Label: Extension
Amplifier.Description: Details specified by extension
